title: The Pugs Bus and the Rain

args.text: The pugs bus rolls into town with a loud screech of tires and a broken-down engine, wheezing like a dying beast, and the three pugs — Whee-Zee, the fiery bassist and singer, Wörmer on guitar and keys with a sneer and a sarcastic grin, and Krötch the drummer with a wild eye and a smirk — step out onto the curb behind the neon-lit nightclub, dressed in ripped band tees and dirty jeans. They start smoking clove cigarettes in the rain, passing them around like sacred relics, and begin playing a fast, rebellious punk set for the noodlings who have gathered around, dancing in their bare feet and laughing too hard. Whee-Zee shouts lyrics about "frozen milk and broken dreams," Wörmer adds sharp harmonies, and Krötch pounds the drum kit with such intensity that the pavement shakes.
